title: Sr. Researcher James A. Harkness' Personnel File

HAVE A PLEASANT DAY. @@ @@ [[include :scp-wiki:component:id-card |css=-- |photo=https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/sr-researcher-james-a-harkness-personnel-file/jaharkness |level=4 |name=James Anselm Harkness |dept=QSM, Novel Conceptual Studies |position=Lead Researcher |id-number= 43-82817-2H |expiry=07/2028 ]] [[div class="oheader tiny slim turquoise"]] //Above: Harkness, appearing displeased, as is typical.// [[/div]] @@ @@ [[<]] [[tabview]] [[tab HOME]] [[>]] [[module Rate]] [[/>]] ------ [[=]] [[div class="yui-navset yui-navset-top" style="padding:6px;width:50 rem;margin:0 auto; display:block;"]] @@ @@ +++ [[span class="bd"]]**RANDOM ARTICLE**[[/span]] [[size 80%]] [[[/sr-researcher-james-a-harkness-personnel-file?| REROLLðŸ”€]]] (60s cooldown) [[/size]] @@ @@ [[div class="oheader duplo vanta"]] [[module ListPages created_by="Billith" category="*" separate="true" limit="1" perPage="1" order="random" tags="-author -supplement -splash"]] **%%title_linked%%** @@ @@ [[div class="description"]] %%content{2}%% [[/div]] @@ @@ [[size 80%]] %%tags%% [[/size]] [[/module]] [[/div]] [[/div]] [[/=]] [[<]] @@ @@ **Name:** [[[system:page-tags/tag/james-harkness|Sr. Researcher J. A. Harkness]]] **Alias:** [https://billith.space Billith][[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]Harkness claims the choice of moniker is a reference to his childhood nickname, a name that existed far before the HBO Television series //True Blood// aired. Yes, I know it featured an onscreen romance with an identical name. Please stop bringing it up, I don't even watch the show.[[/span]] **Clearance Level:** IV **Current Assignment:** **{{[QUERY: DENIED]}}** **Biography:** Born 31 July 1979 in Hoboken, NJ, Sr. Researcher James Anselm Harkness was recruited out of university by the Foundation during their 1990's campaign for members of the then-fledgling Mobile Task Force Rho-9 ("Technical Support").[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]Whether or not this campaign was related to the impending Y2K-Class ("Number Crunch") Scenario remains unknown. However, it should be noted that Harkness never received and/or never retained the necessary Task Force training and was instead offered an administrative IT position at Site-19 shortly after the new millennium.[[/span]] In that time, he had begun working in close proximity to [[[scp-1549|technology]]] and [[[scp-3959|information]]]-based SCPs, as a network manager and go-to "fix my shit" guy.[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]Displaying nearly-anomalous capability to restore the functions of faulty hardware by giving them a --//few hard smacks on the top//-- full diagnostic check and an extensive routine maintenance workup.[[/span]] Following quarterly personnel wellness evaluations, it was deduced that Harkness possesses a high cognitohazard resistance[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]A value of 149, placing him well above the top 99th percentile of Foundation employees.[[/span]] and thus, despite his adamant refusal, has since been utilized with the study of [[[scp-3545|several]]] [[[scp-5800|powerful]]] [[[scp-3330|cognition-affecting]]] [[[scp-3533|SCPs]]] during his extensive and often reluctant Foundation career. He currently resides in Site-43's personnel lodge. %H:%M %Z (%O ago)%% %%content%% %%comments%% | category: %%category%% [[/module]] [[/div]] [[/div]] [[/<]] [[/tab]] [[tab WRITINGS]] [[>]] [[module Rate]] [[/>]] ------ [[<]] [[*user Billith]], contributor since 2017 Total Pages: 66 {{crom}} ranking: #71/3164 {{scpper}} ranking: [https://scpper.com/user/3042342 72] Status: Active [[/<]] @@ @@ [[=]] **__Articles and Stats:__** [[include more-by:billith]] @@ @@ @@ @@ @@ @@ @@ @@ [[size 80%]] [[include :scp-wiki:component:coltop | show=ADDITIONAL PREFERENTIAL DATA | hide=COLLAPSE ]] [[<]] * [[[https://billith.space|BILLITH.SPACE]]] - //the hub// * //[[[https://slowgramming.bandcamp.com|SLOWGRAMMING]]]// - experimental downtempo vibes from 15+ years of self teaching. Retired staff and factions warlord in ye olde Minecraft pvp community. Led a small band of 20-25+ individuals to war against several large-scale (some 100+ member) organizations. The historical page for these individuals can be found [[[http://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/servers/clans/539862-knights-of-amnesia-minecraft-2009-2012-historical|here]]]. Semi-renowned puzzle/adventure [https://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/mapping-and-modding-java-edition/maps/2997658-1-15-escape-of-the-mind-huge-puzzle-adventure map] maker and big thinks person, I s'pose. Enjoys (but is terrible at) mountain climbing, (better at) backpacking, analog audiovisual modulation, production and vfx, graphic design, writing(ofc). * LITERATURE - //The House of Leaves//, //The People of Paper//, Jorge Luis Borges, Asimov, Calvino, Koestler, a lot of high strangeness / fringe science stuff ala Michael Talbot's //Holographic Universe//. * MUSIC - I can get into nearly anything but typically genres with -wave or -hop in the name are a safe bet. [[[https://youtu.be/sWeG68lNcVA|Here]]] [[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YEim1TS8H2w|are]]] [[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PsD5MVMIRJ0|a]]] [[[https://youtu.be/qfezuimoLZk|few]]] [[[https://youtu.be/oKZjWqlF-V8|examples]]]. * TV - TWIN PEAKS, Scavenger's Reign, Gravity Falls, Ozark, Fringe, R&M, Devs, Dark, Infinity Train (rip), * MOVIES - Everything Everywhere All at Once, Coherence, The One I Love, Titane, The Fountain, Enter the Void, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Asteroid City, Reality, I Saw the TV Glow, Resolution/The Endless, THE SUBSTANCE, The Congress, Mars Express, etc. Notable movie buff- Lanthimos, Aronofsky, Lynch, Noe, etc. * OTHER - [[[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQHSzkDDVNx1DSjXpfNUD1A|HOOH]]]:[SECRETS_HIDDEN_BEYOND_THE_SIGHT], [https://www.youtube.com/c/ThisRoomDoesNotExist This Room Does Not Exist], r/DankMemesFromSite19 + the DMFS19 Discord (moderator). [[include :scp-wiki:component:colend]] @@ @@ //UNDER CONSTRUCTION - MORE TO BE ADDED// @@ @@ @@ @@ [[/<]] [[/tab]] [[tab RECS]] [[>]] [[module Rate]] [[/>]] ------ [[<]] //Having read many entries, I have many favorites. Below you will find one from each mainlist series, one tale, one joke article, one -EX, one canon hub, one international article and one wildcard recommendation. These are subject to change on a whim so feel free to check back to see what's different!// > **[[[SCP-184]]]:** //The Architect// by [[*user Dr Gears]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//The new inside structures continue to be more and more odd, while the outside remains unchanged.//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-1562]]]:** //Tunnel Slide// by [[*user trennerdios]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//"I'm still head-first on my stomach, and my body's at an angle, but I'm in some sort of small tunnel and I'm stuck. I'm completely surrounded by rock or dirt on all sides. I don't have enough room to raise my head or move my arms, and I can't move forward. I really want to get out of here now."//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-2774]]]:** //The Slow-Burn Sloth// by [[*user Moohab]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//You just want to scream. But you can't. You can try for hours and hours. Move an arm, a leg, make a sound. It won't happen. You can't even control when you breathe.//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-3955]]]:** //Eight Notes// by [[*user Henzoid]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//The music is cyclical (cycles) (cycles).//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-4755]]]:** //When We Are Omnipotent// by [[*user Nagiros]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//It is the ceiling: an impassible stone barrier into which we carved our insignia. We marked the conceptual universe as our own.//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-5145]]]:** //I Buried the Sun// by [[*user Tanhony]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//SCP-5145 is a round hole in a square world. As the angles of the world are too sharp for such a logical gap, shredding is the inevitable result.//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-6246]]]:** //Seeing the Sunset// by [[*user Jack Waltz]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//There are lovely moments everywhere.//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-7034]]]:** //Ã† is for Aerials// by [[*user J Dune]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//If this is my last message, Iâ€™m either a pile of guts on the road or I died of a pulled muscle after sitting in my car for so fucking long.//[[/span]] > **[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/the-stars-do-not-wait-for-you The Stars Do Not Wait For You]** by [[*user Dmatix]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//I can enjoy no such delusions, regretfully, for I know what lies beneath and among the sands of the endless desert. A charnel house spanning an entire planet, seven billion human souls ground thin and fine until no trace of their existence could ever be found. I know this because I put them all there.//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-042-J]]]:** //Billions of Anomalous Pillows// by [[*user pxdnbluesoul]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//"Dr. â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ theorizes that [George] Carlin is 'a host spreading the parasite, or an alien or some shit.'"//[[/span]] > **[[[SCP-8900-EX]]]:** //Sky Blue Sky// by [[*user tunedtoadeadchannel]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//Gentlemen, we have failed.//[[/span]] > **[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/competitive-eschatology-hub Competitive Eschatology]:** //Competitive Eschatology// by various > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//The Lock has been opened. The armies and monsters of Revelations and Ragnarok and older, forgotten myths march across the Earth. The old gods have returned, and brand new gods are waking up. And more are waiting in the wings. The ends of the world are here, all of them, and we're not ready.//[[/span]] > **[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/proposition-du-dr-gray SCP-001-FR]:** //Tous les anges n'ont pas des ailes// by [[*user Torrential]] and translated by [[*user macro_au_micro]] > ------ > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//"I just want to open your eyes. To you. To the O5. To the Foundation. To the whole world."//[[/span]] > **[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/components-hub Components Hub]:** //A Comprehensive List of Article Components// compiled by [[*user Cole 13]] and the collective efforts of many talented folks. > ------- > [[span style="color:#b1b1b1;"]]//Components are defined, by the 05 Command Tech Hub Tag List, as "A page that is designed to be imported onto other pages via the [[include]] syntax in order to add new design, style or functionality.//[[/span]] @@ @@ @@ @@ [[/<]] [[/tab]] [[tab NESTED]] @@ @@ [[=]] [[collapsible show="LOAD EXPERIENCE" hide=" "]] [[<]] [[html]]
CLICK INTERACTION PANE AND SELECT TO BEGIN
DEDUCTIONS: 10
At each scale, scan aberrations to identify errors in the simulation. Failure to reveal all aberrations before proceeding to the next zoom scale is considered grounds for termination. You get ten chances at perfection, and one minute per frame. Good luck.
CONTROLS:
ARROW KEYS to SELECT NODE
ENTER or CLICK to SCAN
SPACE to SHIFT FRAME
